newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Winterthur says to merge unit with Josi.
newsitem.headline: Winterthur says to merge unit with Josi.

text.p: Winterthur Insurance Co said on Monday its Belgian unit Winterthur-Europe Assurances would merge with Assurances Groupe Josi SA.

"Winterthur-Europe Assurances, the Belgian subsidiary of Winterthur Insurance Co, and Belgium's Assurances Groupe Josi SA have agreed to merge their insurance business in Belgium," the company said in a statement.
"This merger will reach 26 billion Belgian francs and a market share of more than five percent. The new group thus advances to one of the six leading insurers in Belgium."

It said Josi's main shareholders, Holding Groupe Josi and COBEPA, would sell their 97.85 percent stake to Winterthur-Europe Assurances (WEA) and at the same time take a 14.45 percent stake in WEA via a capital increase.
It said the move implemented Winterthur's strategy to boost its market presence sharply in Belgium in light of increased competition.
